imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Bold wordmark logo for a short-video reel app with a dark background and vibrant accent color, horizontal layout (reel-logo.dim_400x100.png)
- Small play/reel icon for use in navigation or card overlays, minimal flat style on transparent background (reel-icon.dim_64x64.png)

existing_features.title: Implement a playable 3D car driving experience in the frontend using React Three Fiber (Three.js), including a drivable car object and a simple environment/track.
Add keyboard controls for driving: accelerate, brake/reverse, and left/right steering, with reasonable default key bindings (e.g., WASD and Arrow keys).
Add a third-person follow camera that tracks the car smoothly (position and look-at), keeping the car centered and maintaining a consistent viewing angle.
Implement basic driving physics suitable for arcade gameplay (speed, acceleration, friction/drag, steering sensitivity), and prevent the car from falling through the ground.
Add a minimal HUD overlay showing at least current speed and basic instructions for controls (in English).
Add a simple game loop UX with Start/Restart and Pause/Resume controls (UI buttons and/or a key toggle).

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme for the app UI (colors, typography, layout) that matches a racing/arcade aesthetic and is used consistently across screens/overlays (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette).
Add basic performance safeguards for the 3D scene (reasonable geometry counts, lighting, shadows settings) so the game runs smoothly on a typical laptop browser.
Generate and include static image assets for the game UI (logo/title mark and HUD icon(s)) and render them from frontend static assets (do not route images through the backend).

Replace the current 3D car game frontend entirely with a reel-style short video/content feed app. The app should display a vertical, full-screen scrollable feed of video or content cards (reels), where users can swipe or scroll through individual items one at a time, similar to a social short-video experience.

Each reel card should display a placeholder video or looping animation, a title, a short description, a username/author label, and interaction icons (like, comment, share) aligned to the right side of the card in the style of a standard reel UI.

Add a minimal top navigation bar with the app name/logo and optional tab navigation (e.g., 'For You', 'Following'). Apply a coherent visual theme with a dark background, bold typography, and vibrant accent colors (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette) that fits a modern short-video/reel aesthetic consistently across all screens.

Seed the feed with at least 5 mock reel items stored as static data in the frontend (no backend persistence required). Each mock reel must include a unique id, title, description, author name, and a placeholder looping video or animated visual (e.g., a colored gradient loop or a short looping clip from a public CDN).

new_feature_requests.summary: Clear out the existing Motoko backend actor so it is a clean placeholder with no car game logic, ready for future reel-app features.
